Description.li: Random Genetics Framework is designed to generate random colonists based off your own conditions
Built with compatibility and ease of use in mind, this documentation should address all questions.
After the gene is added to a pawn, it will assign all the genes it was told to and then remove itself.

ReasonsToUse.li: You have over 5000 genes in your modlist and want more variety
You want a Xenotype to be more diverse in genetics being chosen
You can't make up which gene you want to add to a Xenotype and want to add both
You want to add a gene to a xenotype but only when another mod is available, and you want to add another gene with it to balance it out
You like diversity and are tired of your Xenoptypes all having the same shade of green hair when there are over 400 different hairdefs
You don't want to create an entirely new Xenotype to give a pawn a super special ultra instincts gene.

ThingsYouCanDo.li: Generate a random gene based on various conditions like metabolism, exclusionTag, or if it has an ability or prerequisite.
Generate random hair or skin colors that are all similar by RBG, Hue, Saturation, or Value.

Have a set of genes that will only be used if a certain mod is active
You can tell it to add base biotech genes and outside genes at the same time
Adjust weights and fillers so certain selections are more common than others.

UsingThisDocumentation.li: The files 01-04 can be copy and pasted into the Defs folder to see how they work for demonstration purposes
This file and 05Notes.xml can not be copied into Defs. Rimworld will yell at you.

compatibility.li: I haven't tested all 7000 genes, but everything I've tested so far has worked.
This has compatibility with RedMattis' Big and Small - Framework. With their permission, I used their code for betterprerequisites to ensure compatibility
